data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 9 steps to the left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps to the right. Take 10 steps backward. In order to complete the three tasks, one would need to take 10 steps backward and 9 steps left. So, the answer is No.

One of the directions asks you to take 4 steps and then walk back 4 sets of steps. The answer: Yes.

Turn around means you are returning to your starting point. If you take 6 steps to begin with, there are exactly six steps you have to take to arrive at the starting point. We assume that you are attempting to return to that starting point. So, the answer is yes.

In the first step, you say no. Then, turn left. In the last step, you say yes. So, the answer is Yes.

Right Turn is a common way to get back to the starting point. Left Turn is a common way to get from left to right. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you are in good condition. If you take one step backwards, you are in a more serious state and should return to your starting point as soon as you can. So, the answer is yes.

You always face forward. While following instructions, take 3 steps left while always facing forward. For example, take 3 steps left, take 10 steps left, take 9 steps left, take 10 steps left and then 3 steps left. Reversing directions will show you the opposite direction. So, the answer is No.

When you take 1 step forward, you're stepping on the right side of the street. When you take 7 steps backward, you're stepping on the left side of the street. Your stepping on right side of the street is the same as when you took 7 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.
